title: Unable to shutdown gracefully
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `erigon version 2021.10.1-alpha`

OS & Version: Linux

Commit hash : ef80fd54b1c6c82aae92f5fa24cbd381e8577b50

#### Expected behaviour
Erigon can be shut down gracefully and then started again.

#### Actual behaviour
Erigon is shut down with SIGINT and cannot be started again (corrupt data).

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
1. I build a container image:
```
...
RUN git clone --recurse-submodules -j8 --branch v2021.10.01 https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon.git
WORKDIR erigon
RUN make erigon
...
STOPSIGNAL 2
CMD exec erigon --datadir=/data/erigon --chain ropsten
```
2. run the container with podman
3. stop the container. Logs:
```

[INFO] [10-05|14:23:00.307] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=2496000 blk/second=2355.200 alloc="390.15 MiB" sys="901.00 MiB"
[INFO] [10-05|14:23:30.306] [1/18 Headers] Wrote block headers       number=2654208 blk/second=5273.600 alloc="377.25 MiB" sys="1017.88 MiB"

```


Is it supposed to be stopped with stopsignal 2 (SIGINT) or maybe something else?

show output of: `./build/bin/integration print_stages --datadir=<your_datadir>`
